reason: Task decomposition: The task requires identifying the 2019 British Academy Games Awards winner, finding its Wikipedia page, and counting revisions before the release month as listed on the most recent 2022 entry. All three members executed identical methodological approaches with exceptional consistency. Member evaluation: All members correctly identified God of War (2018) as the Best Game winner at the 15th BAFTA Games Awards (April 2019 ceremony). Each member successfully accessed the Wikipedia page for 'God of War (2018 video game)' and extracted the release date as April 20, 2018. All three conducted comprehensive revision history analysis using Wikipedia API with proper pagination (6 requests each), applying the same cutoff methodology (March 31, 2018 - end of month before April release). Cross-analysis reveals perfect convergence: All members reached identical conclusions with 477 pre-release revisions from page creation (June 14, 2016) to March 2018. No contradictions exist between approaches. Synthesis evaluation: The unanimous result across three independent analyses using identical API methodologies provides extremely high confidence. All members demonstrated rigorous technical execution with proper date filtering, comprehensive data extraction, and detailed documentation. Final validation: The consistent 477 revision count across all three analyses, combined with identical timeline parameters (June 2016 creation to March 2018 cutoff) and matching technical implementation details, confirms this as the definitive answer. Quality assurance confirmed through multiple verification layers and comprehensive workspace documentation by all members.
